alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham; Interior Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 11:35AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Heavy rained fueled by tropical moisture, is moving N into the northward into the coast of Maine and southeastern NH this afternoon. Isolated thunderstorms are possible as well. Areas that receive several heavy bands of rain or a slow moving band of rain may experience flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal York and Interior York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Coastal Rockingham, Interior Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas especially in areas that have storm drains blocked by leaves.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
